ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a survey course in organizational theory which covers some of the core schools within economic sociology including organizational ecology, neo-Institutionalism, Identity, the sociology of markets and Entrepreneurship.I would recommend this course to anyone studying or specializing in organizational behavior, whether within Public Health, Management, or Sociology.

Overview of organizational theories on firm behavior. Recommended for anyone interested in firm behavior/management theory/management applications. Would also recommend taking some course in economics either as a prerequisite or concurrent with this course (many of our discussionsincluded economics, which would be hard to follow without any background in the subject).

I would recommend the class. It engages people from a diversity of backgrounds. The class brought together people with backgrounds in psychology, economics, public health, and sociology. The readings and discussion were illuminating for all involved. Plus the mix of backgrounds brought forth different perspectives that contributed to my understanding of the readings. If a student wants an organized and engaging overview of Org Theory, this is the class!
I would recommend the course to anyone who is looking for a good PhD-level introduction to organization theory or macro-OB.

I would highly recommend the course to anyone interested in organization theory, or organizations in general. The course provides a great overview of the seminal readings in the discipline and practice critically evaluating theories and empirical approaches.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Yes, this course was very useful for deepening and broadening my knowledge of organizational behavior and allowing me to begin developing my own research.
This course was foundational for me in my learning about organizational theory.

Yes, I am interested in creativity and innovation from a psychological persepective. Seeing how entrepreneuship, creativity, and innovation are conceptualized and studied in sociology and macro organizational studies was refreshing and invited deeper thinking in my own research domain.
I consider this course extremely important because it provided the opportunity to read and critically evaluate the most seminal readings in the field.
